Soldier Field Cycling Series
description: The Soldier Field Cycling Series takes place around Soldier Field on Lake Michigan in Chicago. The goal of the Soldier Field Cycling Series is to develop the cyclists of tomorrow and showcase the sport by making it easily accessible and maximizing its exposure.
course: The course is located in the South Lot of Soldier Field between Soldier Field and the McCormick Place Convention Center.
registration: To register for the races go to bikereg.com.
notes: The races are broken down by ages for the juniors and by sex and category for adults.
directions: Located near Chicago’s downtown and Museum Campus at 1410 S. Museum Campus Drive. The RTA Travel Information Center provides scheduling information for all CTA, Metra and PACE services. For information, please call 312.836.7000 or visit www.rtachicago.com.

title: Lincoln Trail State Park Cycling Challenge
description:
Lincoln Trail State Park RR
Road Bicycle Race
Lincoln State Trail Park
Marshall, Ilinois

 Presented by
Rapid Running Event Management
Marshall, Ilinois
August 28, 2010

Sponsored by

Quality Lime Company, Wheaties,Clark County Title Company, Punch Energy Drink, Pizza Hut, Martin\'s IGA, and B& T Drainage



Online Registration Closes Thrusday, August 26, 2010 at 12:00 PM ET
Road Bicycle Race-Aug 28, 2010 9am-4pm
Start Times are Illinois Time!

This event benefits Soles 4 Souls Organization

Bring your new or used shoes to be donated to Soles 4 Souls!

This event is in patner with the Lincoln Trail Park 4.5 Mile Challenge on Friday evening and the Time Trial Saturday Evening. For discounts on both events or group rates please contact our sales department at sales@rapidrunning.com
course:
Road Race is a Hilly 4.5 mile loop!

8 Mile Time Trial in the country roads of Clark County! 

Second Race is $15

Map of Course:

http://www.mapmyride.com/route/us/il/marshall/791127082637917179

 Promoter reserves the right to alter the race if necessary. Contact David Mason @ 812-841-6523

LICENSES: All races will be held under USAC permit pending. Riders without an annual USAC licenses will be required to purchase a 1-day license for $10. 1-year and renewals will be available at registration for $60.

All USAC rules apply. Helmets are required at all times.

CATEGORY DESCRIPTION: Beginners:  All first-year racers and one-day licenses must race  Category 5, Womens 4 Masters, or Juniors. Please check your 2010 USAC license.  If you disagree with your category, apply for an upgrade at USACycling.org.

Directions:

16985 East 1350th Road
Marshall, IL 62441-4742
(217) 826-2222


Registration:  

Online Registration Closes Thrusday, August 25, 2010 at 12:00 PM ET

Additional $10 fee for race-day registration. Second Race entry $15

Race day registration opens at 8:00AM August 28, 2010  and closes 15 minutes prior to each race start

Racers must present a valid USA Cycling License.

Cat 5 Men and Womens 4 only may purchase 1-day license for $10

Unattached riders add $5 to registration( This fee waived with 1-day license)

This is a USA Cycling event held under permit. All USA Cycling rules apply.

Day-Of Entry fees are cash (preferred) or check (bring cash).

All riders must sign a release form.

 

Any additional information please contact us at david.mason@rapidrunning.com

title: Oglesby Downhill
description: Come check out our new downhill line.
course: Our course starts in Oglesby\'s Leigh Park and winds its way down through a monster rock garden to the Vermillion river.
notes: This is a non-competitive event designed to showcase our new downhill line.  Event will be timed.
directions: Oglesby lies near the intersection of Interstates 80 & 39.  Leigh Park is located at the corner of E. Walnut St and Ed Hand Hwy in Oglesby.
